register.description: The register configures the attributes of the video window. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Enable Luma Key transparency matching
Inverse Gamma support [using the CLUT table]
The field configures the DISPC VID to process incoming data as premultiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. Default setting is non premultiplied alpha data
Enables the self refresh of the video window, from its own DMA buffer only

Determines the priority of the video pipeline. The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipelines. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there are only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between the normal priority pipelines
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Video Preload Value
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Automatic self refresh mode
Describes the frame buffer flip operation
Color Space Conversion full range setting
Video Nibble mode [only for 1-, 2- and 4-bpp]
Enable the color space conversion. The HW does not enable/disable the conversion based on the pixel format
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Video Format. It defines the pixel format when fetching the video frame buffer
Video pipeline Enable

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the video window. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Number of OCP TAGS to be used for the pipeline [from 0x0 to 0xF]. A value of 0x0 means only a single tag will be used. A value of 0xF means all 16 tags can be used
Alignment [MSB or LSB align] for unpacked 10b/12b YUV data
Mode of packing for YUV data [only for 10b/12b formats]
Size of YUV data 8b/10b/12b
Defines the VC1 range value for the CbCr component from 0 to 7
Defines the VC1 range value for the Y component from 0 to 7
Enable/disable the VC1 range mapping processing. The bit-field is ignored if the format is not one of the supported YUV formats

register.description: The register configures the base address of the single video buffer. In case of single plane ARGB or YUV, this is the BA. In case of two plane YUV, this is the BA_Y. In case of two plane RGB565-A8, this is the BA_Alpha. BA__0 & BA__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only BA__0 is used. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address. Base address of the video buffer [Aligned on pixel size boundary except for the following. In case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required. In case of YUV422, 2-pixel alignment is required. In case of YUV420, byte alignment is required]

register.description: The register configures the base address of the single video buffer. In case of single plane ARGB or YUV, this is the BA. In case of two plane YUV, this is the BA_Y. In case of two plane RGB565-A8, this is the BA_Alpha. BA__0 & BA__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only BA__0 is used. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address. Base address of the video buffer [Aligned on pixel size boundary except for the following. In case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required. In case of YUV422, 2-pixel alignment is required. In case of YUV420, byte alignment is required]

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for two plane YUV or RGB buffer for two plane RGB565-A8, for the video window. BA_UV__0 & BA_UV__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only BA_UV__0 is used. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address aligned on 16-bit boundary Base address of the UV video buffer used only in case of YUV420-NV12

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for two plane YUV or RGB buffer for two plane RGB565-A8, for the video window. BA_UV__0 & BA_UV__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only BA_UV__0 is used. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address aligned on 16-bit boundary Base address of the UV video buffer used only in case of YUV420-NV12

register.description: The register returns the Video buffer size for the video pipeline

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Video DMA buffer Size in number of 128-bits

register.description: The register configures the video buffer associated with the video pipeline. Shadow register

bitfield.description: DMA buffer High Threshold. Number of 128-bits defining the threshold value
DMA buffer Low Threshold. Number of 128-bits defining the threshold value

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C01 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C00 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C10 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C02 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C12 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C11 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C21 coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C20 coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
C22 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Row-2 pre-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]
Row1 pre-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Row-1 post-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]
Row-3 pre-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]

register.description: The register defines the global alpha value for the video pipeline. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 corresponds to fully opaque

register.description: MFLAG_THRESHOLD Register

bitfield.description: MFLAG High Threshold
MFLAG Low Threshold

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with the video layer before up/down-scaling. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the video picture Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory [program to value minus one]. When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded to 2exp[11]

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory [program to value minus one]. The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit [program to value minus one]. When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded to 2exp[11]

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with the video window. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0

Number of bytes to increment between two pixels Encoded unsigned value [from 1 to 255] to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid The value 1 means next pixel The value 1+n*bpp means increment of n pixels For YUV420. Max supported value is 128

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffer of the video pipeline. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
DMA buffer preload value. Number of 128-bit words defining the preload value

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with the video window. For YUV420 formats this corresponds to the Y Buffer. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value [from -2^31-1 to 2^31] to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*bpp means increment of n pixels The value 1- [n+1]*bpp means decrement of n pixels

register.description: The register configures the 16-bit base address extension. It is the base-address of the single video buffer for single plane ARGB or YUV. For the Y buffer for two plane YUV. For the Alpha buffer for two plane RGB565-A8. 0 & 1 : For ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address extension [16 bits]. Addr extension to make the address space 48b wide

register.description: The register configures the 16-bit base address extension. It is the base-address of the single video buffer for single plane ARGB or YUV. For the Y buffer for two plane YUV. For the Alpha buffer for two plane RGB565-A8. 0 & 1 : For ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address extension [16 bits]. Addr extension to make the address space 48b wide

register.description: The register configures the 16-bit base address extension of the UV buffer for two plane YUV or the RGB buffer for two plane RGB565-A8. 0 & 1 : For ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address extension [16 bits]. Addr extension to make the address space 48b wide

register.description: The register configures the 16-bit base address extension of the UV buffer for two plane YUV or the RGB buffer for two plane RGB565-A8. 0 & 1 : For ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Video base address extension [16 bits]. Addr extension to make the address space 48b wide

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Row-3 post-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]
Row-2 post-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the UV buffer associated with the video window for YUV420 formats. For non-YUV420 formats this register is unused. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value [from -2^31-1 to 2^31] to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1- [n+1]*bpp means decrement of n pixels

register.description: The register configures the Color Look Up Table CLUT for VID pipeline. CLUT is used in conjunction with bitmap formats

bitfield.description: Defines the location in the table where the bit-fields VALUE_{R,G,B} is stored
8-bit R-value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit-field INDEX
8-bit G-value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit-field INDEX
8-bit B-value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit-field INDEX

register.description: The register configures the Color Look Up Table CLUT for VID pipeline. CLUT is used in conjunction with bitmap formats

register.description: The register configures the safety sub-region. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Indicates which frames to be skipped while doing FRAMEFREEZE or DATACHECK [Useful for interlaced displays]. 0x0: No frames are skipped, 0x1: Even Frames are skipped starting from second frame after ENABLE, 0x2: Odd Frames are skipped starting from first frame after ENABLE, 0x3: Reserved

Allowed maximum number of frames with the same frame signature. When the freeze frame counter reaches 1 over this value [freeze_frame_thold+1], a freeze frame detection will occur. Note: The freeze frame counter is cleared on reset -OR- MISR not enabled -OR- terminal count reached -OR- compare == no match
Initial seed selection control
Mode of operation of the safety check module
Safety check Enable for the region. Note: Transition from 0 to 1 clears the signature register

register.description: The register captures the signature from the MISR of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

bitfield.description: The register configures the reference signature of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

register.description: The register configures the position of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Y position of the safety sub-region. Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the Y position of the sub-region on the screen. The first line on the top of the screen has the Y-position 0
X position of the safety sub-region. Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the X position of the sub-region on the screen. The first pixel on the left of the screen has the X-position 0

register.description: The register configures the reference signature of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

bitfield.description: The register configures the reference signature of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

register.description: The register configures the size of the safety sub-region. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Height of the safety sub-region. Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the height of the sub-region on the screen. One line height region has value of 0
Width of the safety sub-region. Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the width of the sub-region on the screen. One pixel wide region has value of 0

register.description: The register configures the seed [initial value] of the MISR. Otherwise, the MISR is initialized with 0xFFFF_FFFF. Shadow register

bitfield.description: The register configures the seed [initial value] of the MISR. Otherwise, the MISR is initialized with 0xFFFF_FFFF. Shadow register

register.description: The register configures the LUMA KEY transparency min and max values. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
12b luma_key_max value
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
12b luma_key_min value
